remarks: A line equals the join of any two of its distinct points (atoms). (Contributed by NM, 29-Apr-2012.)
statement:
lneq2at.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
lneq2at.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
lneq2at.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
lneq2at.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
lneq2at.n $e |- N = ( Lines ` K ) $.
lneq2at.m $e |- M = ( pmap ` K ) $.
lneq2at $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ X e. B /\ ( M ` X ) e. N ) /\ ( P e. A /\ Q e. A /\ P =/= Q ) /\ ( P .<_ X /\ Q .<_ X ) ) -> X = ( P .\/ Q ) ) $.
